    • Uses of AbstractContinuation in fr.sorbonne_u.components.examples.cps.components

      Subclasses of AbstractContinuation in fr.sorbonne_u.components.examples.cps.components 
      Modifier and Type Class Description
      static class  ValueConsumer.ComputeAndThenPrintContinuation
      The class ComputeAndThenPrintContinuation implements the continuation for computeAndThePrint to sum the current value with the sum of other processed values which is received as parameter when called.
      static class  ValueConsumer.ComputeAndThenPrintFinalContinuation
      The class ComputeAndThenPrintFinalContinuation implements the final continuation for computeAndThePrint that simply output the result to the component tracer.
      Methods in fr.sorbonne_u.components.examples.cps.components with parameters of type AbstractContinuation 
      Modifier and Type Method Description
      void ValueConsumer.computeAndThenPrint2​(int n, AbstractContinuation<java.lang.Integer> continuation)
      the baseline service rewritten with BCM continuations to get the values and call itself recursively with a new continuation to consume the sum of the values.
      void ContinuationExamples.sumVectorMultitask​(java.util.Vector<java.lang.Double> vector, AbstractContinuation<java.lang.Double> continuation)
      sum the vector passing the result to the given continuation ; in this example, continuations are called as tasks different from the one of the call to sumVectorUnitask to release the component thread between each call.
      void ContinuationExamples.sumVectorUnitask​(java.util.Vector<java.lang.Double> vector, AbstractContinuation<java.lang.Double> continuation)
      sum the vector passing the result to the given continuation ; in this example, continuations are called within the same task as the call to sumVectorUnitask.
